sentences.sContent: He made a fortune selling property in Spain.
sentences.sCn: 他在西班牙卖房产，发了大财。

sentences.sContent: My first painting sold for £25, a small fortune then for an art student.
sentences.sCn: 我的第一幅画卖了25英镑，这在当时对一个学艺术的学生来说是一大笔钱。

sentences.sContent: He died in poverty in 1947, but his art is worth a fortune .
sentences.sCn: 1947年他在贫困中死去，但是现在他的美术作品值大钱了。

sentences.sContent: The carpet must have cost a fortune .
sentences.sCn: 这块地毯肯定花了不少钱吧。

sentences.sContent: It is quite easy to decorate your house without spending a fortune .
sentences.sCn: 不花大钱装修房子也是很容易的。

sentences.sContent: Her personal fortune was estimated at £37 million.
sentences.sCn: 她的个人财产估计有3,700万英镑。

sentences.sContent: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.sCn: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

phrases.pCn: 寻找发迹的机会；寻出路
花大价钱；价格很高；值一大笔钱

trans.tranOther: a very large amount of money
